children.value: State with multiple values, mutually exclusive state, updating styles for sub shapes are supported after V3.4.
State of item (Node/Edge) build the fast relationships between 「interactions/data changes」 and 「changes of item styles」.

e.g.: the 'hover' state of a node is activated when the mouse enters the node, and the style of the node is changed to response the interaction; 'hover' state is inactivated when the mouse leave the node, and the style of the node is resumed.
In actual scene, state has lots of implicity recommand and complexity.
: Assign a new state and clear all the existing states on a node;
: e.g. the 'bodyState' of a node representing a person has four values 'healthy', 'suspect', 'ill', and 'dead';
: e.g. 'healthy', 'suspect', 'ill', and 'dead' for 'bodyState' are mutually exclusive to each other, any two of them will not exist on a person in the same time;
Update the styles for all the sub shapes on a node or an edge

: e.g. a node consist of a rect, a text and a icon image. When the state of the node is chagned, styles of all the shapes can be changed to response it;
Modify the state configurations: modify the style configurations for a state easily.
To address the issues above, we have the following functions for states in G6 3.4:
Define a state with unified method;
The global state in G6 is defined by
directly. You can also define the styles in the object with the key equals to the
Expect set the global styles for items(nodes/edges), you can also define different styles for different items by assgin

properties.ariaLabel: state styles for sub shape permalink

children.value: In general, an item(node/edge) consists several a keyShape and some sub shapes. Before V3.4, state styles are only available for keyShape, which means users need to define state styles for other sub shapes in
function when custom a node or an item type.
G6 3.4 supports state styles for sub shapes. They can also be defined by two ways as

// Calling the following code, the styles of sub-element and text-element will be changed
function to update the state styles for an item.
G6 V3.4 supports state with multiple values and binary values:

, means the state is activated or inactivated respectivly;
Multiple value: e.g. a node represents a person with 'bodyState', which has four values: 'healthy', 'suspect', 'ill', 'dead'.

Binary state is commonly used in interactions, e.g. hover, selected, etc. When a node is selected, the selected state is activated with true value; the selected state is inactivated with false when the node is deselected.
Set the binary state by calling

State with multiple values exists in complex actual cases, e.g. the 'bodyState' of a node representing a person has four values 'healthy', 'suspect', 'ill', and 'dead'. The binary state can not satisfy such situation.

properties.ariaLabel: update the configurations for state styles permalink

children.value: Update the Configurations for State Styles
Before V3.3, G6 does not support modification on the configurations for state styles. And
can only be used to update the default style for keyShape. With V3.4,
supports updating the default styles and state styles for keyShape and other sub shapes.
You can update the default styles for keyShape and sub shapes by assigning the object with the key equals the
// Update item with the default style of keyShape and other sub shapes
// for keyShape's fill, stroke, and opacity
// the styles for the sub shape named 'node-text'
also can be used to update the state styles for keyShape and sub shapes with
There might be two situations when calling
The state style to be updated is already activated on an item,
: the style will be changed immediately after calling
The state style to be updated is not active on an item,
: The style will be changed after calling
can be used to cancel one or more states set by
G6 does not explicitly provide the state priority mechanism. But the
function which is used to get the value of a state, helps users to control the priority by themselves. e.g.:
// Activate the 'active' state of the item to be true
// If the value of 'active' state is false, the 'hover' state can be set to true
